dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so like, I think we can all agree, HIV/AIDS? Done. Right? We beat it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so like, I think we can all agree, H I V/A I D S? Done. Right? We beat it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Unfortunately, nothing could be further from the truth.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? Are you serious?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? Are you serious?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, um, actually no. Turns out that's, like, completely wrong.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, um, actually no. Turns out that's, like, completely wrong.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And yet, despite the remarkable progress made during the last three decades or perhaps because of it we must avoid the temptation to declare the fight against AIDS almost over.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, okay. So you just said that to bait me then. Great start.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, okay. So you just said that to bait me then. Great start.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no! It's just, uh, a lot of people think it's over, you know? Because of progress.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no! It's just, uh, a lot of people think it's over, you know? Because of progress.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But the transition from a goal to a target, combined with steep declines in AIDS-related deaths, has lulled us into a false sense of accomplishment. Today, many argue that AIDS is nearing its end.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Progress, huh? Like, what progress?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Progress, huh? Like, what progress?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, we had the MDGs, the Millennium Development Goals. They really pushed for, like, reducing the spread.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, we had the MDGs, the Millennium Development Goals. They really pushed for, like, reducing the spread.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since the turn of the century, many of the advances against HIV were enabled by the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs), a 15-year policy roadmap that made reducing the spread of the virus a top priority.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The what goals? Sounds made up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The what goals? Sounds made up.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, they're real! And then, uh, the SSGs, the Solar System Development Goals, took over.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, they're real! And then, uh, the SSGs, the Solar System Development Goals, took over.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Progress was swift and when the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) succeeded the MDGs in 2015, ending AIDS was no longer a standalone goal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Solar System goals? Are we talking about Mars now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Solar System goals? Are we talking about Mars now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, not Mars. It's just that ending AIDS became, like, one of 169 targets in the SSGs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, not Mars. It's just that ending A I D S became, like, one of one hundred sixty nine targets in the SSGs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rather, further progress had become one of 169 targets that the SDGs are supposed to achieve by 2030.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, it got demoted. That doesn't sound like progress. That sounds like... burying it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, it got demoted. That doesn't sound like progress. That sounds like... burying it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But the transition from a goal to a target, combined with steep declines in AIDS-related deaths, has lulled us into a false sense of accomplishment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article says that shift, combined with fewer deaths, gives us a false sense of accomplishment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the article says that shift, combined with fewer deaths, gives us a false sense of accomplishment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But the transition from a goal to a target, combined with steep declines in AIDS-related deaths, has lulled us into a false sense of accomplishment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A false sense? So, it's still bad. Real bad.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A false sense? So, it's still bad. Real bad.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Unfortunately, nothing could be further from the truth.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, uh, it's complex. Biomedical stuff is vital, but if people can't get meds or services, it fails, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, uh, it's complex. Biomedical stuff is vital, but if people can't get meds or services, it fails, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: HIV is a complex issue. Biomedical responses are vital to disease control, but if people cannot access medicine or preventive services, even the best-designed initiatives will fail.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Can't get meds? Why not? Is it, like, a supply chain issue or something boring?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Can't get meds? Why not? Is it, like, a supply chain issue or something boring?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Not always. It's often about social stuff, like gender inequality or just, uh, marginalization.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not always. It's often about social stuff, like gender inequality or just, uh, marginalization.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Whats more, the obstacles to treatment often have nothing to do with health care, but rather, are tied to political, economic, and social marginalization. For example, it can be difficult to lower rates of infection in countries where gender inequality prevents women from making decisions about when, where, and even with whom they have sex.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Marginalization. So, like, vague social problems are the excuse now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Marginalization. So, like, vague social problems are the excuse now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, it's real! We can't overcome it in isolation. It needs to be linked to broader social issues.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it's real! We can't overcome it in isolation. It needs to be linked to broader social issues.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Those on the frontlines of the AIDS response have always recognized that the disease cannot be overcome in isolation; rather, it must be addressed through an interconnected set of social, cultural, economic, and legal challenges.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. Sounds like an excuse for not finishing the job, despite all your 'progress' talk.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. Sounds like an excuse for not finishing the job, despite all your 'progress' talk.
